Beef ###Beef and Broccoli {-} Ingredients 1/3 cup Shaoxing rice wine sake 3 TBSP + 2 TSP soy sauce 1 TBSP cornstarch 1 lb beef strip steak or ribeye sliced thin against the grain 1/4 cup oyster sauce Only use 2/3 of this amount 1 TBSP chile-garlic sauce 1/2 TBSP for marinade 1/2 TBSP for sauce 1/2 cup + 1 TBSP neutral oil (i.e. canola) 2 bunches of broccolini 1 half slivered green pepper 2 TBSP unsalted butter Instructions In a large bowl, whisk together the wine, 2 tablespoons of the soy sauce, 1/2 TSP of chili-garlic sauce and the cornstarch. Add the beef to the bowl, and toss to combine, then cover the bowl, and set aside for 20 minutes or so. Combine in a small bowl the remaining soy sauce, the oyster sauce, and the chile-garlic sauce. Mix together then add a TBSP of water and mix again. Set aside for later. Heat the 1/2 cup of oil in a wok set over high heat. When the oil is hot and shimmering, add about holf the beef to the wok, and stir-fry until it is browned, crips, and barely cooked through (~ 2 minutes). Transfer to a bowl or plate, and set aside. Repeat with the remaining beef. Pour off the oil in the wok, wipe it out with a towel and return it to the stove on high heat. Add the remaining TBSP of oil, swirl it around and heat it until it is smoking. Add the broccoli and cook, tossing and stirring frequently until lightly charred in spots (~ 2 minutes) Add 2 TSBP water to the wok and toss the broccoli in the steam for an additional 2 minutes. Add the beef back to the wok, then add the sauce you made. Cook, stirring and tossing frequently, for 30 seconds or so. Add the butter and stir and toss again for 30 more seconds. Serve immediately with rice Steak au Poivre

Chicken Harissa Chicken Ingredients 2 TBSP harissa (New York Shuk Signature Harissa) 5 TBSP if mild (recommended) 4 1/2 TBSP extra-virgin olive oil 2 1/2 TSP kosher or flaky sea salt 1.2 TSP freshly ground black pepper 1/2 TSP ground cumin 3 chicken thighs (recommended) 3 chicken legs 1 1/2 pounds roasting potatoes (such as Yukon Golds) peeled and cut into 1 1/2-inch (4cm) cubes 2 bunches of scallions washed, sliced in half lengthwise, and thinly sliced crossways grated zest of one lemon 1 cup plain yogurt IT IS IMPORTANT THAT IT IS PLAIN YOGURT not greek yogurt! 1 clove garlic peeled and minced lemon or lime juice 1 cup (10-12g) a mix of fresh herbs coarsely chopped parsley mint dill chervil tarragon Marinade Instructions In a large bowl, mix together the harissa, 3 tablespoons of the olive oil, cumin, 2 1/2 teaspoons of the salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of the black pepper. Add the chicken and potatoes, then rub the thighs and legs and potatoes with the marinade. Be sure to use your hands to rub the sauce under the skin of the chicken. Let stand for 30 minutes at room temperature. Chipotle Chicken Kabobs
